2.

$y \propto x^3$

```{r}
y <- c(0,1,2,6,14,24,37,58,82,114)
x <- 1:10
y.model <- x^3

modelset <- as.data.frame(cbind(x, y, y.model))

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(modelset, aes(x)) + 
  geom_line(aes(y = y.model, colour = "Stated Proportion")) + 
  geom_line(aes(y = y, colour = "Actual Data"))
```
 
The dataset does support the stated proportionality model. It looks better as $y \propto x^3$

```{r}
y <- c(0,1,2,6,14,24,37,58,82,114)
x <- 1:10
y.model <- x^2

modelset.2 <- as.data.frame(cbind(x, y, y.model))

ggplot(modelset.2, aes(x)) + 
  geom_line(aes(y = y.model, colour = "Cubic Proportionality")) + 
  geom_line(aes(y = y, colour = "Actual Data"))
```
